subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|i}}: a line [[above]] another (contrast {{l|zh|下}}) — [[up]]. Originally written as {{zh-l|𠄞}}, but changed to this form to prevent confusion with {{zh-l|二}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
From {{der|zh|sit}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|ཡང་རྩེ||summit; pinnacle}} ({{zh-ref|Bodman, 1980}}), {{cog|lus|zo||to be high}}, {{m|lus|zah||to respect; to revere}}.

''[[w:Shijing|Shijing]]'' rimes indicate occasional level tone for pronunciation 2 ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

Pronunciation 1 is the exopassive of pronunciation 2 with suffix ''*-s'', literally meaning "what has been raised" ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). The rising tone in Middle Chinese words with voiced stop initials regularly evolves into departing tone in Mandarin; pronunciation 3 results from {{zh-l|叶韻}}, which artificially preserves classical poetry rhyming words' pronunciations.

subSections.title: Pronunciation 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=shàng
|m-s=sang4
|dg=шон3
|c=soeng6
|c-t=siang5
|g=song5
|h=pfs=song;gd=song4
|j=son3/hon3
|md=siông
|mn=xm,qz,tw:siōng/xm,zz:siāng
|mn_note=Xiamen siāng - only used for “most”
|mn-t=zion7/ziên7/siang6
|mn-t_note=zion7/ziên7 - vernacular (“upper part; up; on; above; in”); siang6 - literary (“superior; most”)
|w=3zaan
|x=shan5/shan4
|x_note=shan5 - vernacular; shan4 - literary
|mc=2
|oc=3,2
|ma=y

}}

subSections.title: Definitions
Pronunciation 2
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=shàng
|m-s=sang4
|c=soeng5
|c-t=siang1
|g=song5
|h=pfs=sông/sóng;gd=song1/song3
|h_note=sông / song1 - “to go up; to go; to attend” (major reading); sóng / song3 - “to fit; to install; to apply”
|j=son3/hon3
|md=siông/chiông
|md_note=siông - “to go up” (major reading); chiông - only in “to pull up”
|mn=xm,tp,kh,yl,hc,tc,sx,km,mg:chiūⁿ/zz,tn:chiōⁿ/qz,lk:chiǔⁿ/xm,tp,kh,yl,hc,tc,sx,km,mg:chhiūⁿ/zz,tn:chhiōⁿ/qz,lk:chhiǔⁿ
|mn_note=chiūⁿ/chiōⁿ/chiǔⁿ - “to go up” (major reading); chhiūⁿ/chhiōⁿ/chhiǔⁿ - only in “to pull up; to grow; to pile up”
|mn-t=zion6/ziên6
|w=3zaan
|x=shan5/shan4
|x_note=shan5 - vernacular; shan4 - literary
|mc=1
|oc=1+2,1
|ma=y
|cat=v,part
}}
